goal.ch: 本課的主題為「個人的即地緣政治的」，意在置換西方女性主義經典表述「個人即政治」及其身份政治所預設的狹隘個人主義框架，轉而將個體扣連至地緣政治格局的歷史縱深，目的在從宏觀的角度來反省、重組我們的世界。
goal.en:
This course aims to reframe the classic Western feminist assertion “the 
personal is political“ by moving beyond its narrow individualistic framework 
of identity politics. Instead, it connects the individual to the historical depth of geopolitical structures, intending to reflect on and reorganize our world from a macro perspective.

outline.ch: 通過歷史化的文化研究取徑，本課將帶領同學探索，在促成現代個體化趨勢中佔關鍵地位的性部署，是如何鑲嵌於殖民現代化的種族化世界體系，而做為當下極端個人主義隱喻的（homo）sexuality，又如何與帝國主義勢力的擴張密不可分，因而有其地緣政治層面的蘊含。涵蓋的主題有（homo）sexuality 的普世化批判、全球金融化下的恐同生產、新自由主義與進步道德主義，以及陳映真、朱天文、林俊頴的小說與思想所中介的東亞後殖民酷兒批判。
outline.en:
Through a historicalized cultural studies perspective, this course will guide
students in exploring how sexual configurations, which play a crucial role in
the trend toward modern individualization, are embedded in the racialized
world system of colonial modernity. It will also examine how
(homo)sexuality, as a metaphor for atomic individualism, is intricately linked with the expansion of imperialist forces, thus bearing geopolitical
implications. Topics include the Foucaultian deployment of sexuality, the
critique of the universality of (homo)sexuality as western ontology, global
financialization and the production of homophobia, neoliberalism and
progressive moralism, and postcolonial East Asia critique as mediated by
the novels of Chen Yingzhen, Chu Tienwen and Lin Chunying.

textbook.en: A course reader will be available at Gaoguan
